CSDUID: Based on Statistics Canada's Standard Geographical Classification (SGC) 2016. Census subdivision (CSD) is the general term for municipalities (as determined by provincial/territorial legislation) or areas treated as municipal equivalents for statistical purposes (e.g., Indian reserves, Indian settlements and unorganized territories).

The broadband internet access indices provide a relative measure of access to broadband internet in rural areas. Two versions of the index, Index 1 and Index 2, have been produced to enable aspects of rural internet access to be emphasized and to address differing user needs.

Index 1 takes a comprehensive view of broadband internet in rural areas by scoring access across three dimensions: internet speed, number of access technologies, and number of internet service providers.

Index 2 takes a more straightforward view of broadband internet access by focusing only on internet speed, which is the single most important element of internet access.
